title: Foil Flingza Roller
paragraphs: The Foil Flingza Roller is a main weapon in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3. It is a Foil-branded version of the Flingza Roller, and it comes with a different loadout.

In Splatoon 2, the Foil Flingza Roller is nearly identical in appearance to the Flingza Roller. The only difference between the two is that the Foil Flingza Roller has a sticker bearing the Foil logo on the Swiss Army Knife.
In Splatoon 3, the Foil sticker is still present, but the weapon's color has changed from red to blue.
The Foil Flingza Roller was released on 18 November 2017 at 02:00 UTC.[1] It comes as a set with Suction Bombs and Tenta Missiles.

Here comes the Foil Flingza Roller! It brings the features of the Flingza Roller but adds a slick gear brand logo so you know it's official. The easy-to-use Suction Bombs and Tenta Missiles go great with a unique roller like this that can take some getting used to. Just roll with it!

The Foil Flingza Roller returned in Splatoon 3 as part of the Fresh Season 2024 update. The weapon now sports a blue color instead of the previous red. Its set contains Suction Bombs and the Splattercolor Screen.

Here comes the Foil Flingza Roller! It brings the features of the Flingza Roller but adds a slick brand logo so you know it's official. Flush out foes with the Suction Bomb sub, then put the vertical swing's long range to use finishing them off. If they run toward you, use the horizontal swing for a quick splat! Or! Wait for the Splattercolor Screen to do its work, and THEN toss out a Suction Bomb in the confusion. They'll get taken out before they even realize which team threw it! This weapon offers a lot of game plans, from the range and coverage of the vertical swing to the quick and decisive horizontal swings. Find the method that works for you!
For competitive tips about the Foil Flingza Roller

- The Foil Flingza Roller is a middleweight weapon.
- The matchmaking range is 140. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- Ink consumption per second while rolling scales from 1.2% to 6% depending on the rolling speed.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).
- When rolling, the player's movement speed is set to 1.08 units per frame.
- After rolling for 1 second, the player begins to dash.
- When dashing, the player's movement speed is set to 1.32 units per frame.
- After rolling, there is a 0.33 second cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- Hitting an opponent while rolling deals 125 damage. Main Power Up increases rolling contact damage up to 143.75.
- When rolling, the Foil Flingza Roller leaves an ink trail that is 52 units wide.
- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- The ink consumption of 8% allows players to attack 12 times before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).
- When attacking with a nearly depleted ink tank, the ink consumption of that attack is reduced to 4%. The damage of that attack is reduced to 25% of the normal amount.
- When attacking, it takes 19 frames to lift the roller (0.32 seconds).
- When attacking while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.72 units per frame.
- After swinging, there is a 0.75 second cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- Attacks have a base damage of 150. Main Power Up increases damage up to 172.5.

- For normal attacks, ink loses damage based on distance traveled. Ink starts losing damage at 50 units and stops losing damage at 117.6923 units. The minimum damage is 30. Main Power Up increases minimum damage up to 34.5.
- The lethal range is 80 units, as this is the farthest distance where ink deals 100 damage.
- In situations where ink falls down, the ink will lose damage as it falls. The minimum damage for falling ink is 15.

- Ink flung from the center of the roller does the greatest damage. Ink that is flung at an angle greater than 12 degrees to the left or right will have lower damage. This low-damage ink starts losing damage after traveling a distance of 28 units and stops losing damage at 90 units. The maximum damage is 100 and the minimum damage is 30. Main Power Up increases maximum damage up to 115 and increases minimum damage up to 34.5.
- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- The ink consumption of 12% allows players to attack 8 times before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).
- When attacking with a nearly depleted ink tank, the ink consumption of that attack is reduced to 6%. The damage of that attack is reduced to 50% of the normal amount.
- When attacking, it takes 42 frames to lift the roller (0.7 seconds).
- When attacking while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.8 units per frame.
- After swinging, there is a 1.17 second cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- Attacks have a base damage of 150. Main Power Up increases damage up to 172.5.

- For normal attacks, ink loses damage based on distance traveled. Ink starts losing damage at 60 units and stops losing damage at 153 units. The minimum damage is 40. Main Power Up increases minimum damage up to 46.
- The lethal range is 105 units, as this is the farthest distance where ink deals 100 damage.
- In situations where ink falls down, the ink will lose damage as it falls. The minimum damage for falling ink is 20.
- Damage does not change based on the angle of the ink.
- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).
- ▲ Vertical fling painting range extended.
- ▲ Vertical fling indirect hit damage range expanded, the area where the damage is above 50.0 was lengthened by about 13%.
- ▲ Vertical fling direct hit damage range expanded, the area where the damage is above 100.0 was lengthened by about 11%.
- ▼ Special points: 180 → 190.

- ▲ Adjusted distance at which damage from a horizontal swing begins to decrease. Increased distances at which damage exceeding 100.0 is dealt by roughly 9% and exceeding 50.0 damage is dealt by roughly 12%.
- ▲ Decreased ink consumption when inking the ground with the roller while moving at top speed by roughly 33%.
- ▲ Extended range in which a horizontal swing will deal 100.0 or more damage by roughly 5%.
- ▲ Special points: 190 → 180.
- ▲ When rolling, the time to reach the maximum speed has been reduced by 30/60 of a second.
- ▲ Increased movement speed while vertical flinging by about 11%.

- ▲ Adjusted the damage attenuation range of the vertical swing, and slightly lowered the maximum damage to compensate.
The combined effect makes it so that the range in which 100.0 or more damage is dealt has been increased by 5%, making this an overall buff.
- The combined effect makes it so that the range in which 100.0 or more damage is dealt has been increased by 5%, making this an overall buff.
- ▲ Increased the radius of the area ink droplets can fall in when making a vertical swing by roughly 12%.
- ▲ Reduced the time required to swing the weapon overhead in a vertical swing by 3/60 of a second: 45 frames → 42 frames.

- The Foil Flingza Roller is a middleweight weapon.
- The matchmaking range is 14. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.
- Ink consumption per second while rolling scales from 1.2% to 6% depending on the rolling speed.
- While rolling, the player's movement speed is set to 0.108 units per frame.
- After rolling for 1 second, the player begins to dash.
- When dashing, the player's movement speed is set to 0.132 units per frame.
- After rolling, there is a 20 frame second cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- Hitting an opponent while rolling deals 125 damage.
- While rolling, the Foil Flingza Roller leaves an ink trail that is 5.2 units wide.
- The ink consumption of 8% allows players to attack 12 times before needing to refill the ink supply.
- When attacking, it takes 19 frames to lift the roller (0.32 seconds).
- When attacking while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.072 units per frame.
- After swinging, there is a 45 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- Attacks have a base damage of 150.

- For normal attacks, ink loses damage based on distance traveled. Ink starts losing damage at 4.2 units and stops losing damage at 10.96923 units. The minimum damage before time-based falloff is applied is 30.
- The lethal range is 7.2 units, as this is the farthest distance where ink deals 100 damage.

- If a glob of ink is in the air for more than 24 frames after being flung, it loses damage each frame until frame 44, at which point it will deal 50% of its original damage. Thus, the minimum damage that can be dealt per glob is is 15.

- Ink flung from the center of the roller does the greatest damage. Ink that is flung at an angle greater than 15.0 degrees to the left or right will have lower damage. This low-damage ink starts losing damage after traveling a distance of 2.0 units and stops losing damage at 8.2 units. The maximum damage is 100 and the minimum damage is 30.
- The ink consumption of 12% allows players to attack 8 times before needing to refill the ink supply.
- When attacking, it takes 42 frames to lift the roller (0.7 seconds).
- When attacking while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.08 units per frame.
- After swinging, there is a 65 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- Attacks have a base damage of 150.

- For normal attacks, ink loses damage based on distance traveled. Ink starts losing damage at 5.2 units and stops losing damage at 14.5 units. The minimum damage before time-based falloff is applied is 40.
- The lethal range is 9.7 units, as this is the farthest distance where ink deals 100 damage.

- If a glob of ink is in the air for more than 40 frames after being flung, it loses damage each frame until frame 65, at which point it will deal 50% of its original damage. Thus, the minimum damage that can be dealt per glob is is 20.
- Damage does not change based on the angle of the ink.

- In Splatoon 2, its icon has the triangular version of the Foil icon, whereas in Splatoon 3, it shares that from the Foil Squeezer. In both games, the weapon itself uses the triangle sticker.
